name: Fingerpicking Patterns
description: Develop fingerpicking technique from basic thumb exercises through Travis picking and arpeggiated patterns.

steps.name: Thumb Exercise — Bass Strings
steps.instructions: Using only your thumb (p), alternate between the 6th, 5th, and 4th strings in a steady pattern: 6-5-4-5, repeating. Keep your wrist relaxed and let your thumb move from the base joint.
steps.notes: Your thumb provides the rhythmic foundation in fingerpicking. It must be rock solid.

steps.name: p-i-m-a Pattern
steps.instructions: Hold an open E minor chord. Assign your thumb to string 6, index (i) to string 3, middle (m) to string 2, ring (a) to string 1. Play the pattern p-i-m-a repeatedly. Each finger plucks one note per beat.
steps.notes: p = pulgar (thumb), i = indice (index), m = medio (middle), a = anular (ring).

steps.name: Travis Picking — Basic Pattern
steps.instructions: Hold a C chord. Your thumb alternates between strings 5 and 4 on beats 1 and 3. Your index and middle fingers fill in on strings 2 and 1 on beats 2 and 4. Pattern: p(5)-i(2)-p(4)-m(1), repeat.
steps.notes: Travis picking is the foundation of folk and country guitar. Merle Travis and Chet Atkins made it famous.

steps.name: Arpeggiated Chord Pattern in 3/4
steps.instructions: Hold an A minor chord. Play the arpeggio: p(5)-i(3)-m(2)-a(1)-m(2)-i(3), giving each note one eighth-note value. This creates a flowing waltz pattern. Try it on Am, then Dm, then E, then back to Am.

steps.name: Dust in the Wind Pattern
steps.instructions: This classic Kansas song uses a fingerpicking pattern on a C chord: p(5)-i(3)-a(1)-m(2)-a(1)-i(3). Practice this pattern slowly until it feels natural, then try moving through C, Cmaj7, Cadd9.

steps.name: Landslide Pattern
steps.instructions: Fleetwood Mac's Landslide uses a Travis-style pattern in 4/4 with an alternating bass. Hold a C chord: p(5)-i(2)-m(1)-i(2)-p(4)-i(2)-m(1)-i(2), with the thumb alternating bass notes on beats 1 and 3. Practice slowly on C, then move through the progression: C, G/B, Am7, G/B.
steps.notes: Keep the thumb's alternating bass steady while the fingers play a rolling pattern on the treble strings. Lindsey Buckingham often plays this with a capo on the 3rd fret.

steps.name: Free Fingerpicking
steps.instructions: Combine the patterns you practiced. Move through chord progressions of your choice using any fingerpicking pattern. Experiment with mixing patterns within a progression.
